content.question: Objects <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, and <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> move with velocities <math alttext="v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>v</mi></math>, <math alttext="negative v divided by 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>-</mo><mi>v</mi><mo>/</mo><mn>3</mn></math>, and <math alttext="negative 2 v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>v</mi></math>, respectively, in the horizontal direction. Which of the following correctly compares speeds <math alttext="S sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>S</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="S sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>S</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="S sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>S</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> of objects <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, and <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> respectively?

choices.label: <math alttext="S sub 1 is greater than S sub 2, which is greater than S sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>S</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>S</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>S</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="S sub 1 is greater than S sub 3, which is greater than S sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>S</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>S</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>S</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="S sub 3 is greater than S sub 2, which is greater than S sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>S</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>S</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>S</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="S sub 3 is greater than S sub 1, which is greater than S sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>S</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>S</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>S</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="S sub 3 is greater than S sub 1, which is greater than S sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>S</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>S</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>S</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

topic.text: 1.1: Scalars and Vectors in One Dimension

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
